title: China Eximbank provides $235 million government concessional loan for Dalian IV Road Infrastructure Project (Linked to Project ID#36735, #55908 and #36690)
description: On December 14, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Suriname signed a $235 million government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [China Eximbank GCL NO (2016) 11 TOTAL NO. (581)] for the Dalian IV Road Infrastructure Project. The GCL carried the following borrowing terms: a 2% interest rate, a 15-year maturity, and a 5-year grace period. The proceeds of the GCL were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract between the Government of Suriname and Dalian International & Technical Cooperation Group Co Ltd. (CDIG), which was signed in August 2013.   The purpose of the project was to add a layer of asphalt to 110 km of existing roads and construct or renovate four bridges. In particular, the project supported the Beekhuizen Bridge, Van Het Hogerhuysstraat Bridge, a bridge over the Saramacca Canal (Saramaccadoorsteek) near Beekhuizen as an extension of the Industrieweg-Zui, New Zanderij-Highway (also known as the 10.3 km Afobakaweg-Zanderij Highway and the Afobakaweg-Johan Adolf Pengel Airport Highway), a 42.5 km East-West connecting road to Wanhati-Tamarin, and Martin Luther Kingweg (Highway).   CDIG was the contractor responsible for implementation. The project, which was divided into two lots (Lot A and Lot B), entered implementation on October 11, 2017 and was completed on August 31, 2019.  However, there are some indications that the China Eximbank loan issued for the Dalian IV Road Infrastructure Project may have underperformed vis-a-vis lender expectations. The Government of Suriname defaulted on its sovereign debt obligations three times during the COVID-19 pandemic. In December 2021, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) announced that ‘Suriname owes arrears to China and India, which have provided assurances, although less specific than those provided by the Paris Club creditors, that they intend to work with Suriname towards a debt restructuring that will restore sustainability. China has consented to [IMF] financing notwithstanding these arrears. [...] An update will be circulated to the [IMF] Executive Board not later than one week prior to the scheduled Board consideration. On the basis of the Surinamese authorities’ commitment noted above, staff expect that debt to China and India will be treated on comparable terms with other bilateral creditors. The arrears constitute a form of financing contribution to the program. China and India have acknowledged that Suriname will continue to run arrears on their official debt until a debt treatment can be agreed.’ The IMF also disclosed in December 2021 that ‘[t]he stock of external arrears is estimated to be at 11 percent of GDP by end-2021, including arrears of USD 61 million to China.’ Then, in May 2023, the IMF announced the ‘[a]n agreement was reached with Paris Club (PC) creditors for a two-step debt treatment in June 2022, and bilateral agreements with most of the PC creditors have been completed. An agreement-in-principle with bondholders was reached on May 4, 2023. The authorities are actively negotiating in good faith with China and India on a debt restructuring agreement.’
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Dalian IV Project or Phase IV Road Project. The Chinese project title is 大连四期项目. 2. This project is the fourth phase in China Dalian International Economic & Technical Cooperation Group Co., Ltd ongoing efforts to rehabilitate roads in Suriname. It is linked to Dalian III (captured via Project ID#36735) and Dalian I (captured via Project ID#55908) and II (captured via Project ID#36690). 3. Sources that do not have a language specified are in Dutch. 4. The GCL from China Eximbank was denominated in RMB, but only its USD equivalent is known. This issue warrants further investigation.5. One official source (https://www.rekenkamer.sr/rapporten-en-statistieken/rekenkamer-jaarverslagen?download=20:rekenkamer-verslag-2017) indicates that the loan agreement (official commitment) date is January 26, 2017 rather than December 14, 2016. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China Eximbank provides $235 million government concessional loan for Dalian IV Road Infrastructure Project (Linked to Project ID#36735, #55908 and #36690)

# Description
On December 14, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Suriname signed a $235 million government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [China Eximbank GCL NO (2016) 11 TOTAL NO. (581)] for the Dalian IV Road Infrastructure Project. The GCL carried the following borrowing terms: a 2% interest rate, a 15-year maturity, and a 5-year grace period. The proceeds of the GCL were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract between the Government of Suriname and Dalian International & Technical Cooperation Group Co Ltd. (CDIG), which was signed in August 2013.   The purpose of the project was to add a layer of asphalt to 110 km of existing roads and construct or renovate four bridges. In particular, the project supported the Beekhuizen Bridge, Van Het Hogerhuysstraat Bridge, a bridge over the Saramacca Canal (Saramaccadoorsteek) near Beekhuizen as an extension of the Industrieweg-Zui, New Zanderij-Highway (also known as the 10.3 km Afobakaweg-Zanderij Highway and the Afobakaweg-Johan Adolf Pengel Airport Highway), a 42.5 km East-West connecting road to Wanhati-Tamarin, and Martin Luther Kingweg (Highway).   CDIG was the contractor responsible for implementation. The project, which was divided into two lots (Lot A and Lot B), entered implementation on October 11, 2017 and was completed on August 31, 2019.  However, there are some indications that the China Eximbank loan issued for the Dalian IV Road Infrastructure Project may have underperformed vis-a-vis lender expectations. The Government of Suriname defaulted on its sovereign debt obligations three times during the COVID-19 pandemic. In December 2021, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) announced that ‘Suriname owes arrears to China and India, which have provided assurances, although less specific than those provided by the Paris Club creditors, that they intend to work with Suriname towards a debt restructuring that will restore sustainability. China has consented to [IMF] financing notwithstanding these arrears. [...] An update will be circulated to the [IMF] Executive Board not later than one week prior to the scheduled Board consideration. On the basis of the Surinamese authorities’ commitment noted above, staff expect that debt to China and India will be treated on comparable terms with other bilateral creditors. The arrears constitute a form of financing contribution to the program. China and India have acknowledged that Suriname will continue to run arrears on their official debt until a debt treatment can be agreed.’ The IMF also disclosed in December 2021 that ‘[t]he stock of external arrears is estimated to be at 11 percent of GDP by end-2021, including arrears of USD 61 million to China.’ Then, in May 2023, the IMF announced the ‘[a]n agreement was reached with Paris Club (PC) creditors for a two-step debt treatment in June 2022, and bilateral agreements with most of the PC creditors have been completed. An agreement-in-principle with bondholders was reached on May 4, 2023. The authorities are actively negotiating in good faith with China and India on a debt restructuring agreement.’
justification: Project focuses on road infrastructure improvements without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Road asphalt layer addition, bridge construction/renovation, general transportation infrastructure

title: Chinese Government provides $1 million grant to help fight Zika epidemic
description: On April 20, 2016, the Chinese Government donated $1 million USD in cash to the Government of Suriname to help fight the Zika epidemic, which began in Suriname at the end of 2015. The purpose of this grant was to purchase medical supplies for health facilities as well as support patients' hospital and medication bills.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government provides $1 million grant to help fight Zika epidemic

# Description
On April 20, 2016, the Chinese Government donated $1 million USD in cash to the Government of Suriname to help fight the Zika epidemic, which began in Suriname at the end of 2015. The purpose of this grant was to purchase medical supplies for health facilities as well as support patients' hospital and medication bills.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare support without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Grant for medical supplies and patient support in response to Zika epidemic

title: China donated 30 bulletproof vests to Suriname police headquarters (linked to #56298 and #56507)
description: According to the Chinese Embassy in Suriname, on December 16, 2016, Chinese ambassador Zhang Jinxiong donated 30 bulletproof vests to the KPS (Korps Politie Suriname), the Suriname police department. The vests were received by the police director at the Suriname Police Headquarters. Additionally, the Chinese Embassy assisted in repairing patrol vehicles, offered training for some officers in China to strengthen police law enforcement capabilities (captured in #56507) and donated two police vans (#56298).
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China donated 30 bulletproof vests to Suriname police headquarters (linked to #56298 and #56507)

# Description
According to the Chinese Embassy in Suriname, on December 16, 2016, Chinese ambassador Zhang Jinxiong donated 30 bulletproof vests to the KPS (Korps Politie Suriname), the Suriname police department. The vests were received by the police director at the Suriname Police Headquarters. Additionally, the Chinese Embassy assisted in repairing patrol vehicles, offered training for some officers in China to strengthen police law enforcement capabilities (captured in #56507) and donated two police vans (#56298).
justification: Project focuses on social development through police equipment donations and training, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of bulletproof vests, police vans, and officer training for law enforcement capabilities

title: China Dalian International donates maintenance equipment to Suriname's Ministry of Public Works
description: According to China's embassy in Suriname, on May 10, 2016, China Dalian International Group donated maintenance equipment to Suriname's Ministry of Public Works.  The donation ceremony was attended by Suriname's Chinese ambassador, Jiang Xiaoyan and Suriname's Minister of Public Works.  The exact amount of equipment is unknown, but it will be used for infrastructure construction and livelihood projects in Suriname and included weedwhackers and lawnmowers.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China Dalian International donates maintenance equipment to Suriname's Ministry of Public Works

# Description
According to China's embassy in Suriname, on May 10, 2016, China Dalian International Group donated maintenance equipment to Suriname's Ministry of Public Works.  The donation ceremony was attended by Suriname's Chinese ambassador, Jiang Xiaoyan and Suriname's Minister of Public Works.  The exact amount of equipment is unknown, but it will be used for infrastructure construction and livelihood projects in Suriname and included weedwhackers and lawnmowers.
justification: Donation of maintenance equipment for infrastructure and livelihood projects without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Weedwhackers and lawnmowers for infrastructure construction and livelihood projects

title: Chinese Government cancels $16 million of the Government of Suriname’s outstanding obligations
description: According to the Ministry of Finance of Suriname, the Chinese Government canceled $16 million of the Government of Suriname’s outstanding debt obligations in October 2016.
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
Chinese Government cancels $16 million of the Government of Suriname’s outstanding obligations

# Description
According to the Ministry of Finance of Suriname, the Chinese Government canceled $16 million of the Government of Suriname’s outstanding debt obligations in October 2016.
justification: Debt cancellation is a financial transaction without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Debt cancellation of $16 million, no specific project or environmental component mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides $15 million grant for Low-Income Housing Project
description: On December 16 and 20, 2016, an exchange of notes between the Chinese Government and the Government of Suriname was signed for the construction of housing projects.   On May 29, 2017, the governments signed an agreement for the construction of 350 housing projects. The Chinese Government provided a grant of $15 million for the project. The estimated total cost of the project is 176 million RMB ($26.6 million).   China Gansu International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation is the contractor responsible for project implementation. This 350-unit housing is part of a larger project of a grant of 1,000 homes from China. The 350 houses will be built at Sabaku Village in North Paramaribo, covering 25 hectares of ready-to-build land. The president formally announced the project on September 30th 2019, and reports indicated that materials were in transit.
staff_comments: Other names of the project include: “Affordable Housing Program (AHP),” “Agreement for Implementing the China-Aided Low-Cost Housing Project,” “1000 Houses China Grant project,” “Implementing the China_Aided Low-Cost Housing Project with the Chinese Government.” The transaction amount has been coded as $15 million per the Suriname Times source, however the 'NonGovWrk' source suggests the 2017 budget for the project was $10 million.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides $15 million grant for Low-Income Housing Project

# Description
On December 16 and 20, 2016, an exchange of notes between the Chinese Government and the Government of Suriname was signed for the construction of housing projects.   On May 29, 2017, the governments signed an agreement for the construction of 350 housing projects. The Chinese Government provided a grant of $15 million for the project. The estimated total cost of the project is 176 million RMB ($26.6 million).   China Gansu International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation is the contractor responsible for project implementation. This 350-unit housing is part of a larger project of a grant of 1,000 homes from China. The 350 houses will be built at Sabaku Village in North Paramaribo, covering 25 hectares of ready-to-build land. The president formally announced the project on September 30th 2019, and reports indicated that materials were in transit.
justification: Project focuses on low-income housing development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 350 housing units, social infrastructure focus, no energy-related components mentioned

title: China donates 25 units of urban sanitation equipment
description: On January 18, 2016, the Chinese Government donated 25 pieces of urban sanitation equipment to the Government of Suriname. 20 sets of wet road sweeping vehicles and 5 combined sewer dredge vehicles were produced by Zoomlion. The cost of the equipment is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China donates 25 units of urban sanitation equipment

# Description
On January 18, 2016, the Chinese Government donated 25 pieces of urban sanitation equipment to the Government of Suriname. 20 sets of wet road sweeping vehicles and 5 combined sewer dredge vehicles were produced by Zoomlion. The cost of the equipment is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on urban sanitation improvement without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of sanitation equipment (sweeping vehicles and sewer dredge vehicles) for urban development

title: China funds Confucius Institute at the Anton de Kom University of Suriname
description: On March 1, 2016, Hanban and Zhejiang Sci-Tech University signed an agreement with Anton de Kom University of Suriname to establish a Confucius Institute.   On February 16, 2017, the unveiling ceremony of the Confucius Institute at Anton de Kom University of Suriname was held. This is the first Confucius Institute in Suriname.  The first Chinese language training classes were held in April 2017, and more than 80 students were enrolled. On May 12, 2017, the official opening ceremony of the first Chinese class in the Institute was held.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China funds Confucius Institute at the Anton de Kom University of Suriname

# Description
On March 1, 2016, Hanban and Zhejiang Sci-Tech University signed an agreement with Anton de Kom University of Suriname to establish a Confucius Institute.   On February 16, 2017, the unveiling ceremony of the Confucius Institute at Anton de Kom University of Suriname was held. This is the first Confucius Institute in Suriname.  The first Chinese language training classes were held in April 2017, and more than 80 students were enrolled. On May 12, 2017, the official opening ceremony of the first Chinese class in the Institute was held.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Institute, Chinese language training classes, cultural education focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates school supplies to hundreds of students in Saramacca (Linked with #70705)
description: On September 28, 2016, a ceremony was held for the Chinese Embassy donation of schoolbags, stationary, and other school supplies to hundreds of local elementary school students in the Saramacca district. Ambassador Zhang Jinxiong and Suriname First Lady Ingrid Bouterse were present at the ceremony. This is the second of two donations of school supplies made by the Chinese embassy in September 2016 - the other is recorded in project 70705.

title: Chinese Embassy donates school supplies to 100 students in the Paramaribo Capital Region (Linked with #70703)
description: On September 20, 2016, a donation ceremony was held for the Chinese Embassy donation of schoolbags, stationary, and other school supplies to 100 local elementary school students in the Paramaribo capital region. Ambassador Zhang Jinxiong and Suriname First Lady Ingrid Bouterse were present at the ceremony. At the ceremony, students performed small programs such as poetry recitation and children’s songs. The donation was the first of two donations of school supplies made in September 2016 - the second is recorded in project #70703.

Ambassador Zhang Jinxiong and Suriname First Lady Ingrid Bouterse were present at the ceremony. At the ceremony, students performed small programs such as poetry recitation and children’s songs. The donation was the first of two donations of school supplies made in September 2016 - the second is recorded in project #70703.
